edu.wpi.cs.jburge.SEURAT.rationaleData
Class RationaleDB

java.lang.Object
  edu.wpi.cs.jburge.SEURAT.rationaleData.RationaleDB
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public final class RationaleDB
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable

This is the MUCH too large class that handles most of the database operations. If you need to get things from the DB in bulk, this is the one to call. The class is set up as a singleton design pattern.

Author:
burgeje
See Also:
Serialized Form

Constructor Detail

RationaleDB

private RationaleDB(int x)
Rationale DB Constructor. This MUST remain PRIVATE in order for this class to stay a d. This class sets up the JDBC database connection using the information from the preferences.

Parameters:
x - - unused parameter.
Method Detail

Notifier

public PublishSubscribeManager<RationaleElement,java.lang.Object,RationaleUpdateEvent> Notifier()

sqlConnect

private void sqlConnect()
Rationale DB connect method for a MySQL database. This method is called from the RationaleDB constructor if the SEURAT preferences specify MySQL.

derbyConnect

private void derbyConnect()
Rationale DB connect method for an Apache Derby local database. This method is called from the RationaleDB constructor if the SEURAT preferences specify Derby.

createTables

private void createTables()
                   throws java.sql.SQLException
Rationale DB method to create the initial tables for a new rationale database. This method is called by the connect methods if a new database needs to be created, and functions by retrieving and executing queries using the RationaleDBCreate class.

Throws:
java.sql.SQLException

getStatement_OntologyEntryFromDB

public java.sql.PreparedStatement getStatement_OntologyEntryFromDB()
Accessor Method For The Ontology Entries FromDatabase Pseudo Constructor. This is how the Ontology Entry Class Retrieves The Prepared Statement

Returns:
A prepared statement for retrieving an ontology entry from the database by name.
See Also:
OntEntry.fromDatabase(String)

getStatement_PatternFromDB

public java.sql.PreparedStatement getStatement_PatternFromDB()
Accessor method. Retrieves the prepared statement for patterns

Returns:

getStatement_AltPatternFromDB

public java.sql.PreparedStatement getStatement_AltPatternFromDB()
Accessor method. Retrieves the prepared statement for pattern alternatives

Returns:

prepareStatements

private void prepareStatements()
Generate prepared statements for use in database queries. The Prepared Statements Make accessing The Database Much Faster.

migrate

private void migrate()
This Code Seamlessly Updates A Database With New Data. It will check the existing database schema and determine whether the desired database properties exist. If the properties do not exist then the database schema will be modified to contain the new attributes with default values. Move This To RationaleDBCreate

See Also:
RationaleDBCreate

public void resetDatabase()
This does not appear to be used!

getElement

private java.lang.String getElement(java.lang.String parentName,
                                    java.lang.String parentTable,
                                    java.lang.String elementName,
                                    RationaleElementType elementType)
Given the name of the parent, the table type of the parent, the name of the element field in the parent table, and the element type, get the name of the element. Ok, this is confusing but the parent table has the ID of the item associated with it, not its name. As an example, you want the ontology entry associated with a claim called "Cheap to code" so you would give the parent name as "Cheap to code", the parent table as "claims", the name of the field that will identy the ontology (rather misleadingly called "elementName" here) as "ontology", and the element type as ONTENTRY.

Parameters:
parentName - - the name of the parent element
parentTable - - the type of table for the parent
elementName - - the name of the field in the parent's table that contains our element
elementType - - the type of element we are trying to get
Returns:
the name of our child element

getClaimOntEntry

public java.lang.String getClaimOntEntry(java.lang.String parentName)
Return the name of the ont entry mapping to the parent claim

Parameters:
parentName - - the parents name
Returns:
our elements name

Parameters:
parentName - - the name of the parent element

the name of the ontology entries

                           int parent,
                           java.lang.String ptype)

associateAlternative

public void associateAlternative(java.lang.String alternative,
                                 java.lang.String artifact,
                                 java.lang.String resource,
                                 java.lang.String name,
                                 java.lang.String message)
Associate an alternative with a resource. In Eclipse, a resource can be a file, attribute, or method. This information is actually maintained using markers (bookmarks and special markers to put the rat icon on the file) but we also store it in the database so we can share it between machines. The database schema also includes the line number, but this is useless in helping us restore the markers between sessions, so the method no longer uses it.

Parameters:
alternative - - the ID of the alternative being associated
artifact - - the Eclipse format artifact identifier
resource - - the file name for the resource - this is what gets displayed in the bookmark
name - - the name of the method or attribute we are associating with
message - - the name of the alternative that is displayed

removeAssociation

public void removeAssociation(java.lang.String resource)
Given the Eclipse format resource, delete all associations to that resource from the associations table. This will remove all the associations to a file.

Parameters:
resource - - the artifact to remove

removeAssociation

public void removeAssociation(java.lang.String resource,
                              java.lang.String message,
                              int lineNumber)
Removes associations of a specific alternative to a specific file at a specific line number. This is very brittle - if the line number comes from a bookmark and the file has been edited it will not match the database!

Parameters:
resource - - the file name where the association is
message - - the name of the alternative it was associated with
lineNumber - - the specific line number

releaseResources

public static void releaseResources(java.sql.Statement stmt,
                                    java.sql.ResultSet rs)
Release our database resources. This is done over and over and over again so we have this nifty utility method to cut down on duplicated code.

Parameters:
stmt - - the statement to close
rs - - the resource to close

releaseResources

public static void releaseResources(java.sql.Statement stmt,
                                    java.sql.ResultSet rs,
                                    java.sql.ResultSet rs2)
Release our database resources. This is done over and over and over again so we have this nifty utility method to cut down on duplicated code. We need the two resource version because sometimes we have to nest queries

Parameters:
stmt - - the statement to close
rs - - the resource to close
rs2 - - the other resource to close

a boolean indicating success or failure which can be used to provide appropriate feedback to the user

exportXML

public boolean exportXML(java.lang.String path)
Exports the whole db to an XML file. (Currently, we're only exporting pattern library and the ontology) This is done by calling the utlity function in RationaleDBUtil.

Parameters:
path -
Returns:
true if it's successful. false otherwise.

addPatternFromXML

getProblemCategoryData

public java.util.Vector<java.lang.String[]> getProblemCategoryData()
This method returns all database info about problem category. Used for XML export String[0] represents the id of each problem category String[1] represents the problem category names String[2] represents the type of each problem category

Returns:
Vector containing String[3]

addXMLRequirements

private void addXMLRequirements()
Deprecated. not using it right now

What appears to be happening with the XML is that the rationale elements are read from the file and stored into vectors. Then, this method is called to put the elements actually INTO the database.
